Job Title: Marketing Manager, Business Operations, Mergers and Acquisitions

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
At MRI, our company culture is more than a talking point – it’s what makes us shine! We value your hard work and encourage you to be your whole self while you do it. Passion, integrity, and inclusion mixed with a healthy dose of fun is what makes us the best fit for your next career move! MRI Software is seeking an experienced, hands-on Marketing Manager to work closely with Business Operations and Global Marketing functions on M&A pre and post-close activities. This role will play a part in essential communications, coordination and tracking growth opportunities across the pre-deal and post-deal phases of an M&A transaction. The right candidate will have proven experience in media, copywriting, trend analysis and research of a high-tech environment.

Responsibilities

 Participate in M&A pre-close planning and preparations Draft content for internal and external communications; coordinate timely reviews and approvals across key functions Create supporting graphics and content for various presentation decks Track, coordinate and confirm completion of PR, social media, email marketing and other communications Coordinate with Marketing Operations on research and data analytics Gather pipeline status weekly and track against targets Partner with M&A Director, marketing, finance and sales teams to maintain an accurate view of marketing performance towards GTM targets Coordinate re-branding, web migration and sales enablement activities for the new acquisition Maintain Marketing M&A Playbook standardization Assist in preparing weekly and ad-hoc communication updates, and reports Prepare monthly newsletters and presentation materials for Department Input to continuous improvement of the scalability of existing M&A processes and building new processes Support ad-hoc pipeline and data requests Manage corporate standard marketing initiatives as assigned

Requirements

 3+ years B2B software marketing experience Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience with: CRM (Salesforce knowledge) Marketing Automation (Pardot knowledge a plus) Adobe Photoshop Microsoft Power Point power user Account Based Marketing (6sense a plus) Data (data analytics, data management, databases) Experience in Business Intelligence tools like Tableau and Power BI preferred but not required Strong analytical skills Excellent relationship-building and project management skills Goal-oriented towards key metrics Strong process and analytical skills to identify inefficiencies and drive improvements Demonstrated cross-functional experience Proactive, problem-solving skills Effective time management skills and comfort juggling fast-paced environment BA/BS degree Approximately 5% travel within US

Our Total Rewards Include

 Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance Plan Options 20 Days - Paid Time Off 401K, includes matching & Roth Flexi Any-Day (knock 2.5 hours off of your day 6 (six) times a year) 11 Paid Holidays Tuition Reimbursement Pet Insurance Unique perks such as a wedding limo, giveaways, holiday-themed celebrations, service awards, and much more… Variety of community engagement opportunities & charitable donation matches

MRI Software named a 2023 Top Workplace by NorthCoast 99!

MRI continues to strive to amaze as a global industry leader in real estate software. Whether you are joining as a new pride member or bringing your expertise back, your talent is important to maintaining MRI’s high client experience standard and continuing our growth in the PropTech space.

MRI is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
